description: All tables related to Communication Services.

tables.name: ACSChatIncomingOperations
tables.description: Communication Services logs of incoming requests to chat operations.

columns.name: TimeGenerated
columns.description: The timestamp (UTC) of when the log was generated.

columns.name: OperationName
columns.description: The operation associated with log record.

columns.name: CorrelationId
columns.description: The ID for correlated events. Can be used to identify correlated events between multiple tables.

columns.name: OperationVersion
columns.description: The API-version associated with the operation or version of the operation (if there is no API version).

columns.name: Category
columns.description: The log category of the event. Logs with the same log category and resource type will have the same properties fields.

columns.name: ResultType
columns.description: The status of the operation.

columns.name: ResultSignature
columns.description: The sub status of the operation. If this operation corresponds to a REST API call, this field is the HTTP status code of the corresponding REST call.

columns.name: ResultDescription
columns.description: The static text description of this operation.

columns.name: DurationMs
columns.description: The duration of the operation in milliseconds.

columns.name: CallerIpAddress
columns.description: The caller IP address, if the operation corresponds to an API call that would come from an entity with a publicly available IP address.

columns.name: Level
columns.description: The severity level of the operation.

columns.name: URI
columns.description: The URI of the request.

columns.name: UserId
columns.description: The request sender's user ID.

columns.name: ChatThreadId
columns.description: The chat thread ID associated with the request.

columns.name: ChatMessageId
columns.description: The chat message ID associated with the request.

columns.name: SdkType
columns.description: The SDK type used in the request.

columns.name: PlatformType
columns.description: The platform type used in the request.

tables.name: ACSSMSIncomingOperations
tables.description: Communication Services logs of incoming requests to SMS operations.

columns.name: TimeGenerated
columns.description: The timestamp (UTC) of when the log was generated.

columns.name: OperationName
columns.description: The operation associated with log record.

columns.name: CorrelationId
columns.description: The ID for correlated events. Can be used to identify correlated events between multiple tables.

columns.name: OperationVersion
columns.description: The API-version associated with the operation or version of the operation (if there is no API version).

columns.name: Category
columns.description: The log category of the event. Logs with the same log category and resource type will have the same properties fields.

columns.name: ResultType
columns.description: The status of the operation.

columns.name: ResultSignature
columns.description: The sub status of the operation. If this operation corresponds to a REST API call, this field is the HTTP status code of the corresponding REST call.

columns.name: ResultDescription
columns.description: The status text response of the result of this operation.

columns.name: DurationMs
columns.description: The duration of the operation in milliseconds.

columns.name: CallerIpAddress
columns.description: The caller IP address, if the operation corresponds to an API call that would come from an entity with a publicly available IP address.

columns.name: Level
columns.description: The severity level of the operation.

columns.name: URI
columns.description: The URI of the request.

columns.name: OutgoingMessageLength
columns.description: The number of characters in the outgoing message.

columns.name: IncomingMessageLength
columns.description: The number of characters in the incoming message.

columns.name: DeliveryAttempts
columns.description: The number of attempts made to deliver this message.

columns.name: PhoneNumber
columns.description: The number used for sending or receiving the SMS message (e.g. +18445791704)

columns.name: NumberType
columns.description: The type of number used for sending or receiving the SMS message (e.g. LongCodeNumber)

columns.name: SdkType
columns.description: The SDK type being used in the request.

columns.name: PlatformType
columns.description: The platform type being used in the request.

columns.name: Method
columns.description: The method used in the request.

columns.name: MessageId
columns.description: The identifier of the outgoing Sms message. Only present if message processed.

columns.name: Country
columns.description: The recipient country.

tables.name: ACSBillingUsage
tables.description: Usage records across all modes of Communication Services.

columns.name: TimeGenerated
columns.description: The timestamp (UTC) of when the log was generated.

columns.name: OperationName
columns.description: The operation associated with log record.

columns.name: CorrelationId
columns.description: The ID for correlated events. Can be used to identify correlated events between multiple tables.

columns.name: OperationVersion
columns.description: The API-version associated with the operation or version of the operation (if there is no API version).

columns.name: Category
columns.description: The log category of the event. Logs with the same log category and resource type will have the same properties fields.

columns.name: RecordId
columns.description: The unique ID for a given usage record.

columns.name: UsageType
columns.description: The type of resource being consumed.

columns.name: UnitType
columns.description: The unit in which the type of usage is measured.

columns.name: Quantity
columns.description: The amount of usage in terms of the specified unit.

columns.name: StartTime
columns.description: Time when the resource consumption started.

columns.name: EndTime
columns.description: The time when resource consumption ended. Optional, as some events are instant by nature.

columns.name: UserIdA
columns.description: User ID consuming the resource.

columns.name: UserIdB
columns.description: User ID consuming the resource for consumables involving two users.

columns.name: ParticipantId
columns.description: Participant Id is the link between billing data and calling data.

tables.name: ACSCallDiagnostics
tables.description: Diagnostics logs provide information about the media transfers that occur in a call. Every log corresponds to an individual media stream and contains information about the emitting endpoint (e.g. the user sending the stream).

columns.name: TimeGenerated
columns.description: The timestamp (UTC) of when the log was generated.

columns.name: OperationName
columns.description: The operation associated with log record.

columns.name: OperationVersion
columns.description: The API-version associated with the operation or version of the operation (if there is no API version).

columns.name: Category
columns.description: The log category of the event. Logs with the same log category and resource type will have the same properties fields.

columns.name: CorrelationId
columns.description: The ID for correlated events. Can be used to identify correlated events between multiple tables.

columns.name: Identifier
columns.description: The indentifier of the call used to correlate. Can be used to identify correlated events between multiple tables.

columns.name: ParticipantId
columns.description: ID of the participant.

columns.name: EndpointId
columns.description: ID of the endpoint.

columns.name: EndpointType
columns.description: Type of the endpoint.

columns.name: MediaType
columns.description: Type of Media.

columns.name: StreamId
columns.description: ID of the stream.

columns.name: TransportType
columns.description: Type of the internet transport layer, it can be UDP, TCP or unknown.

columns.name: RoundTripTimeAvg
columns.description: Average time of a round trip in milliseconds.

columns.name: RoundTripTimeMax
columns.description: Max time of a trip in milliseconds.

columns.name: JitterAvg
columns.description: Average delay of sending the packages in milliseconds.

columns.name: JitterMax
columns.description: Max delay of sending the packages in milliseconds.

columns.name: PacketLossRateAvg
columns.description: Average lost packages.

columns.name: PacketLossRateMax
columns.description: Max lost packages.

columns.name: HealedDataRatioAvg
columns.description: Average healed data ratio for incoming audio.

columns.name: HealedDataRatioMax
columns.description: Maximum healed data ratio for incoming audio.

columns.name: RecvResolutionHeight
columns.description: Receive average resolution height.

columns.name: RecvFreezeDurationPerMinuteInMs
columns.description: Average receive freeze duration per minute in microseconds.

columns.name: VideoFrameRateAvg
columns.description: Average frames per second.

columns.name: JitterBufferSizeAvg
columns.description: Average jitter buffer size in milliseconds.

columns.name: JitterBufferSizeMax
columns.description: Maximum jitter buffer size in milliseconds.

columns.name: PacketUtilization
columns.description: Utilized packets for the media stream.

columns.name: VideoBitRateAvg
columns.description: Average bitrate.

columns.name: VideoBitRateMax
columns.description: Maximum bitrate.

columns.name: StreamDirection
columns.description: The direction of the stream, can be inbound or outbound.

columns.name: CodecName
columns.description: Codec used for the media stream.
Boolean value that identify Teams Phone Extensibility calls.

tables.name: ACSCallingMetrics
tables.description: Aggregated Calling metrics in daily bins based on dimensions like SDK Version, OS name, Subcode.

columns.name: TimeGenerated
columns.description: The timestamp (UTC) of when the log was generated.

columns.name: OperationName
columns.description: The operation associated with log record.

columns.name: OperationVersion
columns.description: The API-version associated with the operation or version of the operation (if there is no API version).

columns.name: Category

columns.name: CorrelationId
columns.description: The unique gguid per dimension.

columns.name: TimestampMax
columns.description: The max timestamp for each dimension.

columns.name: TimestampBin
columns.description: The daily timestamp bin for each dimension.

columns.name: MetricValueAvg
columns.description: The average value of metric per dimension.

columns.name: Unit
columns.description: Unit of metric

columns.name: Goal
columns.description: Threshold defined for a leg to succeed.

columns.name: FailedLegsDcount
columns.description: Number of failed participants per dimension.

columns.name: SuccessLegsDcount
columns.description: Count of succeeded participants per dimension.

columns.name: CallsDcount
columns.description: Count of total Call per dimension.

columns.name: LegsDcount
columns.description: Count of total participants per dimension.

columns.description: Device browser major dimension.

columns.name: MetricName
columns.description: Metric name dimension.

tables.name: ACSCallSurvey
tables.description: Call survey provides information about the call surveys submitted by the participants.

columns.name: TimeGenerated
columns.description: The timestamp (UTC) of when the log was generated.

columns.name: OperationName
columns.description: The operation associated with log record.

columns.name: OperationVersion
columns.description: The API-version associated with the operation or version of the operation (if there is no API version).

columns.name: CorrelationId
columns.description: The ID for correlated events. This field contains the participant ID that allows call survey to be correlated with other calling logs.

columns.name: CallId
columns.description: The identifier of the call used to correlate. Can be used to identify correlated events between multiple tables.

columns.name: ParticipantId
columns.description: ID of the participant.

columns.name: SurveyId
columns.description: The ID of the survey uniquely identifies the call survey.

columns.name: OverallRatingScore
columns.description: Overall call experience rated by the participant.

columns.name: OverallRatingScoreLowerBound
columns.description: Minimum value of the OverallRatingScore scale.

columns.name: OverallRatingScoreUpperBound
columns.description: Maximum value of the OverallRatingScore scale.

columns.name: OverallRatingScoreThreshold
columns.description: The OverallRatingScore greater than this value indicates better quality.

columns.name: OverallCallIssues
columns.description: Comma separated overall issues reported by the participant.

columns.name: AudioRatingScore
columns.description: Audio experience rated by the participant.

columns.name: AudioRatingScoreLowerBound
columns.description: Minimum value of the AudioRatingScore scale.

columns.name: AudioRatingScoreUpperBound
columns.description: Maximum value of the AudioRatingScore scale.

columns.name: AudioRatingScoreThreshold
columns.description: The AudioRatingScore greater than this value indicates better quality.

columns.name: AudioIssues
columns.description: Comma separated audio issues reported by the participant.

columns.name: VideoRatingScore
columns.description: Video experience rated by the participant.

columns.name: VideoRatingScoreLowerBound
columns.description: Minimum value of the VideoRatingScore scale.

columns.name: VideoRatingScoreUpperBound
columns.description: Maximum value of the VideoRatingScore scale.

columns.name: VideoRatingScoreThreshold
columns.description: The VideoRatingScore greater than this value indicates better quality.

columns.name: VideoIssues
columns.description: Comma separated video issues reported by the participant.

columns.name: ScreenshareRatingScore
columns.description: Screenshare experience rated by the participant.

columns.name: ScreenshareRatingScoreLowerBound
columns.description: Minimum value of the ScreenshareRatingScore scale.

columns.name: ScreenshareRatingScoreUpperBound
columns.description: Maximum value of the ScreenshareRatingScore scale.

columns.name: ScreenshareRatingScoreThreshold
columns.description: The ScreenshareRatingScore greater than this value indicates better quality.

columns.name: ScreenshareIssues
columns.description: Comma separated screenshare issues reported by the participant.

tables.name: ACSCallClientServiceRequestAndOutcome
tables.description: Service side request and outcome logs from calling SDK like call join, hangup and state updates as outcomes with http request/response payloads in the property bag.

columns.name: TimeGenerated
columns.description: The timestamp (UTC) of when the log was generated.

columns.name: OperationName
columns.description: The operation associated with log record.

columns.name: Category
columns.description: The log category of the event. Logs with the same log category and resource type will have the same properties fields.

columns.name: CorrelationId
columns.description: The unique gguid per dimension.

columns.name: Level
columns.description: Log level like info/error.

columns.name: DurationMs
columns.description: Duration of an operation in milliseconds.

columns.name: Properties
columns.description: Properties payload based on request/outcome of various calling operations.

columns.name: ResultType
columns.description: Result type like Success/UnexpectedServerError.

columns.name: ResultSignature
columns.description: HTTP result signature.

tables.name: ACSCallClientOperations
tables.description: Call client operation logs provide information regarding operations performed by clients using the Azure Communication Service Calling client SDK. It includes information regarding events raised by the SDK, such as state changes, e.g. createView, startAudio,DevicePermissionRequest. This log will be used by Call Diagnostics Center to visualize a call flow in a time series manner.

columns.name: TimeGenerated
columns.description: The timestamp (UTC) of when the log was generated.

columns.name: CallClientTimeStamp
columns.description: The timestamp (UTC) of when the call client log was generated.

columns.name: OperationName
columns.description: The operation associated with log record.

columns.name: CallId
columns.description: The identifier of the call used to correlate. Can be used to identify correlated events between multiple tables.

columns.name: ParticipantId
columns.description: ID of the participant.

columns.name: OperationType
columns.description: Client operation type.

columns.name: OperationId
columns.description: Client operation ID.

columns.name: DurationMs
columns.description: Client operation duration in millisecond.

columns.name: ResultType
columns.description: Client operation event result type.

columns.name: ResultSignature
columns.description: Client operation event result network code.

columns.name: SdkVersion
columns.description: Azure Communication Service calling client SDK version associated with the log.

columns.name: UserAgent
columns.description: The user agent string of the client application.

columns.name: ClientInstanceId
columns.description: Client instance ID.

columns.name: EndpointId
columns.description: Azure Communication Service calling endpoint ID.

columns.name: OperationPayload
columns.description: Azure Communication Service calling specific operation payload adhering to a defined schema.

tables.name: ACSCallClientMediaStatsCompressedTimeSeries
tables.description: Call client media stats logs provide media statistics about a call made through ACS. These logs are used to provide granular timeseries for quality metrics in Call Diagnostics Center. The logs contains information about media stream type, direction, codec as well as bitrate properties (e.g. max, min, average).

columns.name: TimeGenerated
columns.description: The timestamp (UTC) of when the log was generated.

columns.name: OperationName
columns.description: The operation associated with log record.

columns.name: CallId
columns.description: The identifier of the call used to correlate. Can be used to identify correlated events between multiple tables.

columns.name: CallClientTimeStamp
columns.description: The timestamp (UTC) list of when the ACS client's media stats log was generated.

columns.name: MetricName
columns.description: Client metric name.

columns.name: Count
columns.description: The counts list of a certain media metric statistics.

columns.name: Sum
columns.description: The sums list of a certain media metric statistics.

columns.name: Average
columns.description: The averages list of a certain media metric statistics.

columns.name: Minimum
columns.description: The minimums list of a certain media metric statistics.

columns.name: Maximum
columns.description: The maximums list of a certain media metric statistics.

columns.name: MediaStreamDirection
columns.description: Client media stream direction, i.e. recv or send.

columns.name: MediaStreamType
columns.description: Client media stream type, i.e. video or screen.
Client media stream codec list.

columns.name: ParticipantId
columns.description: ID of the participant.

columns.name: ClientInstanceId
columns.description: Client instance ID.

columns.name: EndpointId
columns.description: ACS calling endpoint ID.

columns.name: RemoteParticipantId
columns.description: ACS remote participant ID.

columns.name: RemoteEndpointId
columns.description: ACS calling remote endpoint ID.

columns.name: MediaStreamId
columns.description: ACS calling media stream ID.

columns.name: AggregationIntervalSeconds
columns.description: ACS calling media stats aggregation interval in seconds.

columns.name: UserAgent
columns.description: ACS calling media stream ID.

tables.name: ACSCallSummary
tables.description: Call summary logs provide an overview about a call made through ACS. There is one log for every participant in the call, and logs contain information about the duration of the call, the duration of the individual participant, the type of participant (e.g. VoIP, PSTN, etc.), as well as the endpoint information like the OS version being used, or the SDK version of the ACS platform.

columns.name: TimeGenerated
columns.description: The timestamp (UTC) of when the log was generated.

columns.name: OperationName
columns.description: The operation associated with log record.

columns.name: OperationVersion
columns.description: The API-version associated with the operation or version of the operation (if there is no API version).

columns.name: Category
columns.description: The log category of the event. Logs with the same log category and resource type will have the same properties fields.

columns.name: CorrelationId
columns.description: The ID for correlated events. Can be used to identify correlated events between multiple tables.

columns.name: Identifier
columns.description: The indentifier of the call used to correlate. Can be used to identify correlated events between multiple tables.

columns.name: CallStartTime
columns.description: Start time of the call.

columns.name: CallDuration
columns.description: Duration of the call in seconds.

columns.name: CallType
columns.description: Type of the call, for example P2P (peer to peer).

columns.name: TeamsThreadId
columns.description: Thread ID of the team.

columns.name: ParticipantId
columns.description: ID of the participant.

columns.name: ParticipantTenantId
columns.description: The ID of the Microsoft tenant associated with the identity of the participant. The tenant can either be the Azure tenant that owns the ACS resource or the Microsoft tenant of an M365 identity. This field is used to guide cross-tenant redaction.

columns.name: ParticipantStartTime
columns.description: Start time of the participant.

columns.name: ParticipantDuration
columns.description: Duration of the participant call in seconds.

columns.name: ParticipantEndReason
columns.description: Participant's call end reason.

columns.name: EndpointId
columns.description: The ID of the endpoint.

columns.name: EndpointType
columns.description: Type of the endpoint, for example VoIP (voice over IP).

columns.name: SdkVersion
columns.description: SDK version.

columns.name: OsVersion
columns.description: Operating System version.

columns.name: PstnParticipantCallType
columns.description: The type and direction of PSTN participants, including emergency calling, direct routing, transfer, forwarding, etc.

columns.name: ParticipantType
columns.description: Description of the participant as a combination of its client (Azure Communication Services (ACS) or Teams), and its identity, (ACS or Microsoft 365). Possible values include: ACS (ACS identity and ACS SDK), Teams (Teams identity and Teams client), ACS as Teams external user (ACS identity and ACS SDK in Teams call or meeting), and ACS as Microsoft 365 user (M365 identity and ACS client).

columns.name: ParticipantEndSubCode
columns.description: Participant's call end reason sub code.

columns.name: ResultCategory
columns.description: The category of participant call end reason.

columns.name: DiagnosticOptions
columns.description: JSON containing the DiagnosticOptions provided during client initialization containing appName, appVersion and tags.

columns.name: CallDebuggingInfo
columns.description: JSON containing the fields with debug details about the call.
Boolean value that identify Teams Phone Extensibility calls.

tables.name: ACSCallSummaryUpdates
tables.description: Call summary logs provide an overview about a call made through ACS. There is one log for every participant in the call, and logs contain information about the duration of the call, the duration of the individual participant, the type of participant (e.g. VoIP, PSTN, etc.), as well as the endpoint information like the OS version being used, or the SDK version of the ACS platform.

columns.name: TimeGenerated
columns.description: The timestamp (UTC) of when the log was generated.

columns.name: OperationName
columns.description: The operation associated with log record.

columns.name: OperationVersion
columns.description: The API-version associated with the operation or version of the operation (if there is no API version).

columns.name: Category
columns.description: The log category of the event. Logs with the same log category and resource type will have the same properties fields.

columns.name: CorrelationId
columns.description: The ID for correlated events. Can be used to identify correlated events between multiple tables.

columns.name: Identifier
columns.description: The indentifier of the call used to correlate. Can be used to identify correlated events between multiple tables.

columns.name: CallStartTime
columns.description: Start time of the call.

columns.name: CallDuration
columns.description: Duration of the call in seconds.

columns.name: CallType
columns.description: Type of the call, for example P2P (peer to peer).

columns.name: TeamsThreadId
columns.description: Thread ID of the team.

columns.name: ParticipantId
columns.description: ID of the participant.

columns.name: ParticipantTenantId
columns.description: The ID of the Microsoft tenant associated with the identity of the participant. The tenant can either be the Azure tenant that owns the ACS resource or the Microsoft tenant of an M365 identity. This field is used to guide cross-tenant redaction.

columns.name: ParticipantStartTime
columns.description: Start time of the participant.

columns.name: ParticipantDuration
columns.description: Duration of the participant call in seconds.

columns.name: ParticipantEndReason
columns.description: Participant's call end reason.

columns.name: EndpointId
columns.description: The ID of the endpoint.

columns.name: EndpointType
columns.description: Type of the endpoint, for example VoIP (voice over IP).

columns.name: SdkVersion
columns.description: SDK version.

columns.name: OsVersion
columns.description: Operating System version.

columns.name: PstnParticipantCallType
columns.description: The type and direction of PSTN participants, including emergency calling, direct routing, transfer, forwarding, etc.

columns.name: ParticipantType
columns.description: Description of the participant as a combination of its client (Azure Communication Services (ACS) or Teams), and its identity, (ACS or Microsoft 365). Possible values include: ACS (ACS identity and ACS SDK), Teams (Teams identity and Teams client), ACS as Teams external user (ACS identity and ACS SDK in Teams call or meeting), and ACS as Microsoft 365 user (M365 identity and ACS client).

columns.name: ParticipantEndSubCode
columns.description: Participant's call end reason sub code.

columns.name: ResultCategory
columns.description: The category of participant call end reason.

columns.name: DiagnosticOptions
columns.description: JSON containing the DiagnosticOptions provided during client initialization containing appName, appVersion and tags.

columns.name: CallUpdatesVersion
columns.description: Experience Version of the log.

columns.name: CallDebuggingInfo
columns.description: JSON containing the fields with debug details about the call.
Boolean value that identify Teams Phone Extensibility calls.

tables.name: ACSEmailSendMailOperational
tables.description: Email Communication Services logs for send operations.

columns.name: TimeGenerated
columns.description: The timestamp (UTC) of when the log was generated.

columns.name: Location
columns.description: The location the request was processed.

columns.name: OperationName
columns.description: The operation associated with log record.

columns.name: OperationVersion
columns.description: The API-version associated with the operation or version of the operation (if there is no API version).

columns.name: Category
columns.description: The log category of the event. Logs with the same log category and resource type will have the same properties fields.

columns.name: CorrelationId
columns.description: The ID for correlated events. This value is populated with the MessageID returned by Email send requests and can be used to identify correlated events between Email Operational tables.

columns.name: Size
columns.description: The size of the email in megabypes.

columns.name: ToRecipientsCount
columns.description: The count of unique recipients on the 'To' line.

columns.name: CcRecipientsCount
columns.description: The count of unique recipients on the 'Cc' line.

columns.name: BccRecipientsCount
columns.description: The count of unique recipients on the 'Bcc' line.

columns.name: UniqueRecipientsCount
columns.description: The unique count of all recipients.

columns.name: AttachmentsCount
columns.description: The count of attachments attached to a request.

columns.name: TrafficSource
columns.description: The traffic source of a request.

tables.name: ACSEmailStatusUpdateOperational
tables.description: Email Communication Services logs for message and recipient delivery status update operations.

columns.name: TimeGenerated
columns.description: The timestamp (UTC) of when the log was generated.

columns.name: Location
columns.description: The location the request was processed.

columns.name: OperationName
columns.description: The operation associated with log record.

columns.name: OperationVersion
columns.description: The API-version associated with the operation or version of the operation (if there is no API version).

columns.name: Category
columns.description: The log category of the event. Logs with the same log category and resource type will have the same properties fields.

columns.name: CorrelationId
columns.description: The ID for correlated events. This value is populated with the MessageID returned by Email send requests and can be used to identify correlated events between Email Operational tables.

columns.name: RecipientId
columns.description: The email address of the recipient who received the message.

columns.name: DeliveryStatus
columns.description: The terminal status of a message. If the recipientId is null, this value represents whether or not the Azure Communication Email Service was able to deliver the message to email providers. If the recipientId is present, this will be the per-recipient status. There should be one event for each recipient.

columns.name: SmtpStatusCode
columns.description: The SMTP status code returned from the recipient email server in response to  a send  mail request.

columns.name: EnhancedSmtpStatusCode
columns.description: The enhanced SMTP status code returned from the recipient email server (if available).

columns.name: RecipientMailServerHostName
columns.description: The mail server host name of recipient.

columns.name: SenderDomain
columns.description: The domain portion of the SenderAddress used in sending emails.

columns.name: SenderUsername
columns.description: The username portion of the SenderAddress used in sending emails.

columns.name: IsHardBounce
columns.description: Signifies whether a delivery failure was due to a permanent or temporary issue. IsHardBounce == true means a permanent mailbox issue preventing emails from being delivered.

columns.name: InternetMessageId
columns.description: The internet message id of the recipient.

columns.name: FailureReason
columns.description: Failure reason for the given SMTP or EnhancedSmtp status code.

columns.name: FailureMessage
columns.description: Verbatim error message for the given SMTP or EnhancedSmtp status code.

tables.name: ACSEmailUserEngagementOperational
tables.description: Email Communication Services logs for message and recipient delivery status update operations.

columns.name: TimeGenerated
columns.description: The timestamp (UTC) of when the log was generated.

columns.name: Location
columns.description: The location the request was processed.

columns.name: OperationName
columns.description: The operation associated with log record.

columns.name: OperationVersion
columns.description: The API-version associated with the operation or version of the operation (if there is no API version).

columns.name: Category
columns.description: The log category of the event. Logs with the same log category and resource type will have the same properties fields.

columns.name: CorrelationId
columns.description: The ID for correlated events. This value is populated with the MessageID returned by Email send requests and can be used to identify correlated events between Email Operational tables.

columns.name: InternetMessageId
columns.description: The field corresponds to the Message-ID property of the email based on the RFC2822. It's a unique message identifier that refers to a particular version of a particular message.

columns.name: RecipientId
columns.description: The count of unique recipients on the To line.

columns.name: EngagementType
columns.description: The type of user engagement.

columns.name: EngagementContext
columns.description: The context of the user interaction.

columns.name: UserAgent
columns.description: The user agent string of the client application.

tables.name: ACSCallRecordingIncomingOperations
tables.description: Communication Services logs of incoming requests to Call Recording operations. Every entry corresponds to the result of a call to the Call Recording APIs, e.g. StartRecording, StopRecording, PauseRecording, ResumeRecording, etc.

columns.name: TimeGenerated
columns.description: The timestamp (UTC) of when the log was generated.

columns.name: Level
columns.description: The severity level of the operation.

columns.name: CorrelationId
columns.description: The ID for correlated events. Can be used to identify correlated events between multiple tables.

columns.name: OperationName
columns.description: The operation associated with log record.

columns.name: OperationVersion
columns.description: The API version associated with the operation or version of the operation (if there is no API version).

columns.name: URI
columns.description: The URI of the request.

columns.name: ResultType
columns.description: The status of the operation.

columns.name: ResultSignature
columns.description: The sub status of the operation. If this operation corresponds to a REST API call, this field is the HTTP status code of the corresponding REST call.

columns.name: DurationMs
columns.description: The duration of the operation in milliseconds.

columns.name: CallerIpAddress
columns.description: The caller IP address, if the operation corresponds to an API call that would come from an entity with a publicly available IP address.

columns.name: CallConnectionId
columns.description: Id of the call connection/leg, if available.

columns.name: ServerCallId
columns.description: Server Call Id.

columns.name: SdkVersion
columns.description: SDK Version.

columns.name: SdkType
columns.description: The SDK type used in the request.

tables.name: ACSCallRecordingSummary
tables.description: Call recording summary logs provide an overview about a recording maed through ACS. There is one log for every recording done, and logs contain information about the duration of the recording, the content (e.g. Audio-Video, Unmixed, Transcription, etc.) and format (e.g. WAV, MP4, etc) types used for the recording, as well as the end reason of recording.

columns.name: TimeGenerated
columns.description: The timestamp (UTC) of when the log was generated.

columns.name: OperationName
columns.description: The operation associated with log record.

columns.name: CorrelationId
columns.description: The ID for correlated events. Can be used to identify correlated events between multiple tables.

columns.name: RecordingId
columns.description: The ID given to the recording this log refers to.

columns.name: ResultType
columns.description: The status of the operation.

columns.name: Level
columns.description: The severity level of the operation.

columns.name: RecordingEndReason
columns.description: The reason why the recording ended.

columns.name: ChunkCount
columns.description: The total number of chunks created fot the recording.

columns.name: RecordingStartTime
columns.description: The time that the recording started.

columns.name: RecordingLength
columns.description: Duration of the recording in seconds.

columns.name: ContentType
columns.description: The recording's content, i.e. Audio Only, Audio - Video, Transcription, etc.

columns.name: ChannelType
columns.description: The recording's channel type, i.e. mixed, unmixed.

columns.name: FormatType
columns.description: The recording's file format.

columns.name: AudioChannelsCount
columns.description: Total number of audio channels in the recording.

tables.name: ACSCallClosedCaptionsSummary
tables.description: Call closed captions summary logs provide an overview about a closed captions made through ACS. There is one log for every closed captions done, and logs contain information about the duration of the closed captions, start time, spoken language and end reason, as well as the cancel reason of closed captions.

columns.name: TimeGenerated
columns.description: The timestamp (UTC) of when the log was generated.

columns.name: OperationName
columns.description: The operation associated with log record.

columns.name: CorrelationId
columns.description: The ID for correlated events. Can be used to identify correlated events between multiple tables.

columns.name: ResultType
columns.description: The status of the operation.

columns.name: Level
columns.description: The severity level of the operation.

columns.name: SpeechRecognitionSessionId
columns.description: The ID given to the closed captions this log refers to.

columns.name: SpokenLanguage
columns.description: The spoken language of the closed captions.

columns.name: EndReason
columns.description: The reason why the closed captions ended.

columns.name: CancelReason
columns.description: The reason why the closed captions cancelled.

columns.name: StartTime
columns.description: The time that the closed captions started.

columns.name: Duration
columns.description: Duration of the closed captions in seconds.

tables.name: ACSRoomsIncomingOperations
tables.description: Communication Services logs of incoming requests to rooms operations, with summaries of room object, lifespan, participants and roles count etc.

columns.name: TimeGenerated
columns.description: The timestamp (UTC) of when the log was generated.

columns.name: OperationName
columns.description: The operation associated with log record. e.g., CreateRoom, PatchRoom, GetRoom, ListRooms, DeleteRoom, GetParticipants, AddParticipants, UpdateParticipants, or RemoveParticipants.

columns.name: CorrelationId
columns.description: The unique ID of the request.

columns.name: OperationVersion
columns.description: The API-version associated with the operation or version of the operation (if there is no API version).

columns.name: ResultType
columns.description: The status of the operation.

columns.name: ResultSignature
columns.description: The sub status of the operation. If this operation corresponds to a REST API call, this field is the HTTP status code of the corresponding REST call.

columns.name: Level
columns.description: The severity level of the operation.

columns.name: RoomId
columns.description: The ID of the room.

columns.name: RoomLifespan
columns.description: The Room lifespan in minutes.

columns.name: RoomParticipantsCount
columns.description: The count of participants in a room.

columns.name: RoomParticipantsConsumer
columns.description: The participants count with consumer role.

columns.name: RoomParticipantsAttendee
columns.description: The participants count with attendee role.

columns.name: RoomParticipantsPresenter
columns.description: The participants count with presenter role.

columns.name: RoomJoinPolicy
columns.description: [Deprecated in version 2023-03-31-preview, all rooms are InviteOnly by default] The policy of a room indicating invite only or CommunicationServiceUsers.

columns.name: AddedRoomParticipantsCount
columns.description: The count of participants added to a room.

columns.name: UpsertedRoomParticipantsCount
columns.description: The count of participants upserted in a room.

columns.name: RemovedRoomParticipantsCount
columns.description: The count of participants removed in a room.

columns.name: PstnDialOutEnabled
columns.description: Flag to true if, at the time of the call, dial out to a PSTN number is enabled in a particular room.

tables.name: ACSCallAutomationIncomingOperations
tables.description: Communication Services logs of incoming requests to Call Automation operations. Every entry corresponds to the result of a call to the Call Automation APIs, e.g. CreateCall, AnswerCall, Play, Recognize, etc.

columns.name: TimeGenerated

columns.name: Level
columns.description: The severity level of the operation.

columns.name: CorrelationId

columns.description: The API version associated with the operation or version of the operation (if there is no API version).

columns.name: ResultType
columns.description: The status of the operation.

columns.name: ResultSignature
columns.description: The sub status of the operation. If this operation corresponds to a REST API call, this field is the HTTP status code of the corresponding REST call.

columns.name: DurationMs
columns.description: The duration of the operation in milliseconds.

columns.name: CallerIpAddress
columns.description: The caller IP address, if the operation corresponds to an API call that would come from an entity with a publicly available IP address.

tables.name: ACSCallAutomationMediaSummary
tables.description: Communication Services summary logs of Call Automation Media operations. Every entry corresponds to the result of a call to the Call Automation Media APIs. (e.g. Play, Recognize).

columns.name: TimeGenerated
columns.description: The timestamp (UTC) of when the log was generated.

columns.name: Level
columns.description: The severity level of the operation.

columns.name: CorrelationId

columns.name: ResultType
columns.description: The status of the operation.

columns.name: OperationName

columns.name: OperationId
columns.description: The ID for media events. Can be used to identify operation events between ACSCallAutomationIncomingOperations table and this.

columns.name: PlayInLoop
columns.description: Describes if the Play was requested to loop.

columns.name: PlayToParticipant
columns.description: True if Play request was targeted to a single participant, false if it was played to all participants.

columns.name: PlayInterrupted
columns.description: Describes if the play operation was interrupted.

columns.name: RecognizePromptSubOperationName
columns.description: Describes the Recognize request's prompt kind, i.e. SSML, Text, File. Only available when Prompt is requested during Recognize operation.

columns.name: ResultCode

columns.name: ResultSubcode
columns.description: The sub status code for the operation.

columns.name: ResultMessage
columns.description: The result message related to the operation.

tables.description: Communication Services Call Automation Media Streaming features usage information. Every entry corresponds to a streaming session between a Start and Stop operation for MediaStreaming or Transcription and records information about the session such as session start time, duration, sessionId, etc. In unmixed streaming cases, participantId of the stream being billed is also included.

columns.name: TimeGenerated
columns.description: The timestamp (UTC) of when the log was generated.

columns.name: CorrelationId
columns.description: The ID for correlated events. Can be used to identify correlated events between multiple tables.

columns.name: StreamingModality
columns.description: The modality of streaming being recorded, eg. AudioStreamingMixed, AudioStreamingUnmixed, Transcription.

columns.name: StreamingSessionId
columns.description: The ID associated with the streaming session belonging to the current record.

columns.name: ParticipantId
columns.description: The participantId of the current participant record for unmixed streaming cases. Will be null for mixed sessions.

columns.name: StreamingStartTime
columns.description: The start time of the streaming session.

columns.name: StreamingDurationInMs
columns.description: The duration of the streaming session in milliseconds

columns.name: CallConnectionId
columns.description: Id of the call connection/leg, if available.

queries.description: Calculates the 90th, 95th, and 99th percentiles of run duration in milliseconds for each chat operation. It can be customized to be run for a single operation, or for other percentiles.

queries.displayName: Top 5 IP addresses per Job Router operation
queries.description: For every job router operation, fetch the 5 IP addresses that have called that operation the most.
List every job router error ordered by recency.
For every job router operation, count the types of returned results.
List rooms error ordered by recency.
For every rooms operation, count the types of returned results.
The average statistics of room properties such as participants count for operation version 2024-04-15.
Returns all distinct combinations of call automation operation and version pairs.

queries.displayName: Calculate Call Automation operation duration percentiles
queries.description: Calculates the 90th, 95th, and 99th percentiles of run duration in milliseconds for each call automation operation. It can be customized to be run for a single operation, or for other percentiles.

queries.displayName: Top 5 IP addresses per Call Automation operation
queries.description: For every call automation operation, fetch the 5 IP addresses that have called that operation the most.
List every call automation error ordered by recency.
For every call automation operation, count the types of returned results.

queries.displayName: Call Automation logs for call connection ID
queries.description: Queries Call Automation logs for a particular call connection ID.

queries.displayName: Call Automation API operations on a call
queries.description: Returns all Call Automation API operation and version pairs for a specific call (correlation ID).

queries.displayName: CallDiagnostics log for CallAutomation API call
queries.description: Queries the diagnostics log for a call which was interacted with by Call Automation API using correlation ID.

queries.displayName: CallSummary log for CallAutomation API call
queries.description: Queries the summary log for a call which was interacted with by Call Automation API using correlation ID.
Query the call survey data and show the overall call rating pie chart.
Query the call survey data and show the audio rating pie chart.
Query the call survey data and show the video rating pie chart.
Query the call survey data and show the screenshare rating pie chart.
Query the call survey data and show the overall call issues column chart.
Query the call survey data and show the audio issues column chart.
Query the call survey data and show the video issues column chart.
Query the call survey data and show the screen issues column chart.
Count the client operations by type, and return the count of each type of operation.
The count of failed outgoing client calls by failure reason.
List all calls found that contains the keyword, and returns the details of the call including rating, quality, issues breakdown etc. This query is also used in Call Diagnostics to search for calls.

queries.displayName: Search all user facing diagnostics in a call
queries.description: Find all user facing diagnostics for all participants in a call by callId.

queries.displayName: Search all participants in a call
queries.description: Find all participants in a call by callId, and return the details of the participants.This query is also used in Call Diagnostics to search for participants.

queries.displayName: Check network quality of all participants in a call
queries.description: Check the network quality of all participants in a call based on media stats and network UFD.

queries.displayName: Fetch time series media stats of all participants in a call
queries.description: Fetch time series media stats of all participants in a given call based on ACSCallClientMediaStatsTimeSeries log

queries.displayName: Search all client operations in a call
queries.description: Find all client operations for all participants in a call by callId. This query is also used in Call Diagnostics to search for client operations.
List all the media metrics included in the ACSCallClientMediaStatsTimeSeries log for each media stream type.

queries.displayName: Metric histogram per media type and direction
queries.description: Plot the histogram of selected metric, per callId, participantId, media type and meida direction
Calculates the number of success and failures of the play operation when played in loop or not.
Calculates the number of success and failures of the play operation when played to a participant or to all.
Calculates the number of success and failures of the recognize operation.

queries.displayName: Success rate by sub operation name
queries.description: Calculates the number of success and failures of the recognize operation based on its sub operation name.
Returns all distinct combinations of Advanced Messaging operation and version pairs.
Calculates the 90th, 95th, and 99th percentiles of run duration in milliseconds for each chat operation. It can be customized to be run for a single operation, or for other percentiles.

queries.displayName: Advanced Messaging top 5 IP addresses per operation
queries.description: For every Advanced Messaging operation, fetch the 5 IP addresses that have called that operation the most.
List every Advanced Messaging error ordered by recency.
For every Advanced Messaging operation, count the types of returned results.
Summary of the message activity per channel for the past 24 hours.
Count of message status for the past 24 hours.

queries.displayName: Number of calls with MediaStreaming active
queries.description: Calculates the number of calls that had MediaStreaming active.
Calculates the number of success of the MediaStreaming operation.
Calculates the number of failures of the MediaStreaming operation.
Calculates the total number of streaming minutes of the MediaStreaming operation.
Calculates the total number of streaming minutes of the MediaStreaming operation per call.

queries.displayName: Media Streaming minutes per call per participant
queries.description: Calculates the total number of streaming minutes of the MediaStreaming operation per call per participant.

queries.displayName: Number of calls with Transcription active
